entry.title: Apex Legends akimbo weapons explained
entry.summary:
Apex Legends Shockwave Season 22 is live now, and it brings a new map among other additions to the game. Among those new features is the introduction of Akimbo weapons mode. This refers to the dual wielding of weapons in Apex Legends, where you have certain weapons in both of your hands to deal damage.
Even though akimbo weapons are fun to use in Apex Legends, there are some things to keep in mind about using two P2020s or two Mozambique together. There are certain buffs and nerfs attached to these combinations. For starters, weapons in akimbo mode turn into automatic weapons, meaning you can just hold onto that trigger and the weapon would continue to fire.
There are no optics available when weapons are in akimbo mode, so you only have the option to hipfire these weapons. To make up for this, Apex Legends players who wish to re-enable optics can holster the second weapon by using the select fire toggle input.
Image via EA
Respawn has added an increased rate of fire and has doubled the magazine size for akimbo weapons. However, there will be a longer reload time (since you have to reload two weapons at the same time). Given that akimbo operates in hipfire mode, looking down sights by aiming will slightly reduce the hipfire spread, so even if there is no optic in place, players shouldn’t forget to aim down sights for better accuracy.
So far, akimbo mode is available only for the P2020 pistol and Mozambique shotgun, making it possible to have two P2020s or two Mozambiques in battle. Akimbo weapons have added a whole new layer to how battles happen in Apex Legends, and while there are only two weapons so far that you can dual-wield, we will perhaps one day get to wield even two Wingman together.

entry.title: Where to find Iron Ore in Fields of Mistria
entry.summary:
While the standard Worn Tools can serve you well initially, upgrading your materials is crucial to collect more advanced items. This includes Iron Ore, a resource that can be quite challenging to locate. We're here to guide you on where to find Iron Ore in Fields of Mistria and what requirements are needed.
Fields of Mistria Iron Ore farming guide
To obtain Iron Ore in Fields of Mistria, you'll need to venture to Level 21 and beyond in the Mines. A barrier will block your path to this level, which you can overcome by unlocking the Water Seal with a few specific ingredients. Collecting a Ruby, Lantern Moth, Stone Loach, and Upper Mines Mushroom will grant you access to the area.
Screenshot by Destructoid
Before you go off into the Mines, ensure to bring a lot of stamina resources to reach the higher levels. The Full Restore spell can be excellent for this, as well as the Stamina Syrup from Valen's Clinic. You may want to pick up some healing remedies, too, just in case an enemy comes knocking at your door.
Once you've unlocked the Mines Level 21 in Fields of Mistria, use a Copper Pickaxe to mine the Iron Ores. Treasure chests and digging spots also provide more of this resource, spawning a whole bundle.
If you have some money to spare, you can purchase Iron Ore and other materials at the Blacksmith's Shop. Balor's Wagon occasionally has Iron Ingots, but they cost 300 Tesserae. With enough resources, you can upgrade your tools and expand their charging range. Additionally, Iron Ingots can be used during the Repair the General Store quest, which will be unlocked during the game's later stages.

entry.title: How to perform a Fast Landing in Mecha BREAK
entry.summary:
Mastering the insane mobility available to you in Mecha BREAK is imperative if you want to be competitive. One of the most powerful, yet obscured, mobility options available to you is Fast Landing, and I'll explain here how you too can use it.
How to use Fast Landing in Mecha BREAK
Fast Landing is a mechanic that allows you to plunge downward to the ground from any verticle position. All mecha in Mecha BREAK can perform it, but thanks to it not being highlighted in the game's tutorial, it's easy to miss such a powerful tool. So, to do a Fast Landing, simply hit ALT by default. Doing so while airborne in any capacity will see you perform a Fast Landing.
The biggest reason why you'd want to use a Fast Landing is for hasty repositioning. There's nothing worse than being caught airborne while a Narukami is scoping you out. You're the very definition of a sit-and-duck in such a scenario, but with Fast Landing, you can easily escape it.
In a similar scope, Fast Landing is also extremely good at breaking enemy lock-ons and general targeting because of just how fast you can reach the dirt from any verticle position. The landing is so quick that it was incredibly difficult for me to even get a screenshot of it in action.
Screenshot by Destructoid
Now, imagine you're trying to aim at someone who decided to use a Fast Landing behind a skyscraper on Gracelynn Skycity. Let's just say that nothing you can do will catch them in the act. You're losing that lock, which is precisely why Fast Landing is so strong. I've found it especially powerful for Falcon and Skyraider because of their natural ability to transform and reposition thanks to their jet transformations.
If you want to stay competitive in Mecha BREAK, mastering Fast Landing is a must. Its blinding speed and exceptional positioning power make it a game-changer. You'll be amazed at the intense engagements you can survive just by utilizing this skill effectively.

Japan's female artistic swimming team brought video games into the spotlight at the 2024 Olympics this past Tuesday by performing to the tune of Nier: Automata's OST.
The Japanese team used "A Beautiful Song" as a part of their highly energetic freeform dance routine, and came just six points short of winning a medal.
The beautiful happening was noticed by Emi Evans, the singer who'd originally lent her vocals to the OST:
And the event didn't go unnoticed by Yoko Taro, the creator of the Nier series himself, who responded by, well, making his face on Twitter.
This is not the first time that Nier: Automata makes an appearance at the Olympics. The opening ceremony of Tokyo's 2020 Olympics also featured one of the game's fantastic songs:
You can totally see that the generation currently competing at the Olympics has games in its DNA, as evidenced by Noah Lyle, the already legendary runner destroys the competition while keeping Yu-Gi-Oh! cards under his equipment.
Gymnast Casimir Schmidt also proudly displays tattoos of Mew and Toad on his huge arms.
This isn't even the first time a video game's OST shows up at the artistic swimming competition. The United States artistic swimming duo also made use of the brilliant "Fithos Lusec Wecos Vinosec" way back in the Athens 2004 Olympics, and ended up taking home the bronze medal.
Japan's song choice makes me very happy, because I've been preaching that Nier: Automata's soundtrack is a transcendent selection of music ever since I got to play the game, but the truth is that we're long past the time when video game OSTs were just fun curiosities. There are many games nowadays whose OSTs are composed of nothing but bangers, so I must ask: which game's soundtrack would you like to see featured in the next Olympics artistic swimming competition?

entry.title: How to get the Fortunate Star bow in Destiny 2
entry.summary:
Destiny 2 wouldn't be the game it is if it wasn't introducing new weapons to acquire all the time. Snagging some new tools and getting their god rolls is the entire purpose of the late game, and is something I try to strive for constantly. One such weapon is a particularly desired bow, introduced very recently. Here's how to get the Fortunate Star bow in Destiny 2.
Where to get the Fortunate Star bow in Destiny 2
Image via Destructoid.
The Fortunate Star is available as part of the Solstice event in Destiny 2. For 2024, this event runs from August 6 until August 27, letting you partake in the event and score a bunch of the new weapons. One such weapon is the Fortunate Star. If you want to farm it directly, your best bet is to run the Bonfire Bash event in the EAZ. Eventually, you should see it drop.

Fortunate Star god roll
If you want to farm for the best roll of the bow, you're looking to for the following perks and attachments:
Bowstring: Agile Bowstring
Arrow: Carbon Arrow Shaft
Perk 1: Archer's Tempo
Perk 2: Destabilizing Rounds
The Agile Bowstring helps out the bow's handling and stability, while Carbon Arrow Shaft adds even more to the stability. Archer's Tempo drastically reduces draw times when hitting enemies in the head, which you'll be doing a lot. Meanwhile, Destabilizing Rounds helps the Void side of the bow and makes it great for Void builds that thrive off debuffing enemies.

entry.title: How to get more crop space in Fields of Mistria
entry.summary:
When you first begin a new save on Fields of Mistria, you have a small plot of farmable land outside your house which has a total of 68 available spaces for crop growth. You could be forgiven for thinking that’s all you can ever have, but there’s a very easy way to get more space.
If you’re not happy with the space provided, you’ll be pleased to know that all you need in order to get some more is a shovel. Unfortunately, you’ll need to put in some work to get one.
How to get a shovel in Fields of Mistria
Screenshot by Destructoid
Your first option is to save up 500 Tesserae in order to purchase a Worn Shovel from the General Store, which might be a tall order if you’re wanting to do this quickly. We’ve got some handy tips on making money in Fields of Mistria, but there’s also another way to get a Shovel if you’re not willing to part with the cash.
You can, if you have the resources, make a Copper Shovel at the Forge. The Copper Shovel comes with the benefit of being able to be charged, allowing you to dig three squares at once rather than one at a time.
You’ll need a total of 40 Copper Ore if you want to take this route, and there’s a couple of ways you can get them:
Head down into the Mines between floors 1 and 20, where Copper Ore is common
Purchase Copper Ore from the Blacksmiths for 50 Tesserae each, as long as you’ve unlocked the Mines
How to get more crop plots in Fields of Mistria
Once you’ve got your choice of shovel in hand, you can begin to expand your arable land. Getting more plots is simple, and you can even turn your entire farm into one massive crop field if you so desire.
Just take your shovel and, as long as there isn’t anything on top of the square of land you want to dig, you can remove the grass and create a dirt square. When you’ve got your dirt area ready, you can then use your Hoe to turn this area into somewhere for your seeds to grow.

The generational uplift is very compelling, even in single-threaded Linux workloads shooting ahead of Intel's 14th Gen Core competition, across nearly 400 benchmarks these new Zen 5 desktop CPUs impress, and these new Zen 5 desktop processors are priced competitively. I was already loving the Ryzen 7000 series performance on Linux with its AVX-512 implementation and performing so well across hundreds of different Linux workloads but now with the AMD Ryzen 9000 series, AMD is hitting it out of the ball park. entry.title: Review: One Piece Odyssey (Switch) - A Safe But Solid Caper For The Straw Hats
entry.summary: Here be dragons. A couple of years ago, it was notable when the Switch remakes of Pokemon Diamond and Pearl were developed not in-house by Game Freak, but by a smaller Japanese support studio called ILCA. That remake project was actually ILCA’s first crack at being the lead developer on a game, and it soon followed this up early last year with One Piece Odyssey, an original JRPG based on the long-running franchise about wacky pirates. Now this release has finally made its way over to the Switch, and we’re happy to report that it’s made the jump almost entirely intact. Though it’s taken a bit of a visual hit, One Piece Odyssey still proves to be an enjoyable and accessible release that's a welcome addition to the Switch’s considerable RPG library. The narrative in One Piece Odyssey is a sort of ‘bottle episode’ that follows the adventures of the Straw Hat Pirates crew after they shipwreck upon a mysterious island called Waford. Shortly after arriving, a mysterious figure takes away their power (cutely represented by everyone dropping from level 40 down to 1) and locks it away in various magical cubes scattered across the island. entry.title: Virtuální Bastlírna vol. 41: Kosmické novinky
entry.summary:
Horka polevila, ale žár nadšení Strahováků z techniky nepolevuje! Za poslední měsíc se stalo několik událostí doslova kosmického charakteru. Došlo k úspěšnému startu a vypuštění sond z rakety Ariane 6, Boeing vyslal Starliner na oběžnou dráhu, kde nyní jeho pasažéři neplánovaně už druhý měsíc setrvávají. KiCAD má novou verzi a blíží se konference k jeho dalšímu vývoji. Objevil se nový čip kombinující RP2040 s ethernetem a povedlo se na čipu vytvořit pulzní safírové lasery. Jsou vám tyto novinky málo? Pak jsou na Virtuální Bastlírnu připravená i obecnější hardwarová témata!
Za HW lze probrat zajímavé nově objevené parazitní jevy v SiC MOSFETech, jak se dá operační zesilovač "zaseknout" nebo k čemu jsou dobré ztrátové koaxiální kabely a kde je sehnat. Samozřejmě bastlíři narazili i na kuriozity, například doutnavkovou logiku nebo plošňák, jehož součástí je ohýbačka na THT součástky.
Software ani tentokrát nezůstane stranou - kromě již zmíněné nové verze KiCADu se dá podívat na stavbu linuxového managovaného switche, NanoKVM, převod videa z DisplayPortu na eink nebo emulátor NESu na Picopadu.
Jak je zvykem, s postupem večera se jistě přejde i k lehce bizarním tématům - kupříkladu, co provedl CrowdStrike, jak zprovoznit Doom na erotických hračkách pro pány, jak vypadá nestandardní 12V USB nebo jak se ztrácí některé části audio záznamů z CD, protože je většina SW neumí správně přečíst.
Příští Virtuální Bastlírna se pod taktovkou projektu MacGyver studentského klubu SiliconHill bude konat ve středu 7. srpna od 20:00 minimálně do 22:00 (ale obvykle končí o dost později). Odkaz na konferenci se před samotnou akcí objeví na bastlířské wiki.

entry.title: Gothic Remake gameplay overview reveals an eccentric open world RPG that still feels like the future
entry.summary:
It's a hell of a thing to showcase a remake weeks after kiboshing the developers of the original game. In early July, Gothic creators Piranha Bytes were reportedly shuttered as part of Embracer Group's mad race to trim costs, following their decade-long acquisition binge. Watching THQ Nordic's new Gothic Remake trailer, below, feels a little like watching a vivisectionist parade about in somebody else's skin. Still, the remake's developers Alkimia Interactive aren't to blame for Embracer's fuck-ups, and I am selfishly happy to see Gothic return as an Unreal Engine 5 production - even if I didn't play the original back in 2001.
Sin did play the original game, and in her 2016 retrospective, she paints an absorbing picture of a dark fantasy "microsociety" in which every community "has a reason to exist, a means of providing for itself, a social order, and a long term goal". It's a setup that reminds me of my beloved Roadwarden, even as the sight of grumpy lizards slinking through undergrowth has me silently mouthing "fus roh dah".

entry.title: World Of Goo 2 review: an inventive return to goo with some flies in the ointment
entry.summary: The first World Of Goo was a cheerful parade of goopy engineering with a sense of never-ending novelty (well, never-ending for about four hours). Every level would introduce a new goo type or a twist on the basic bridge-building puzzle that challenged you to get a gaggle of gurgling balls to the nearest pipe. World Of Goo 2 pursues that sense of novelty with just as much twitchy eagerness as its predecessor, throwing new toys and goos at the player in an effort to keep you on your sludge-coated toes. That pursuit doesn't always result in pleasing new levels, though. There is a "hit and miss" feeling to things this time around. But those hits are hits. For anyone who has spent the last 16 years yearning for more sticky structure-building: I hope you like comically unpredictable fluids. Read more

An attendee at San Diego Comic-Con was looking at a set of figures based on characters from the series when they saw that the plaque accompanying the figures was labelled with the words "Legacy of Kain: Soul Reaver 1 & 2 Remastered" alongside the logo for Crystal Dynamics. I suppose if you throw a coin enough times, one day it will land on the side with the head of a jawless vampire on it. Read more

entry.title: "AI protections remain the sticking point" for today’s SAG-AFTRA game actor strike
entry.summary: As of today, the The Screen Actors Guild-American Federation of Television and Radio Artists (SAG-AFTRA) has called a strike of the Interactive Media Agreement - effectively, video game voice acting, motion capture work, and other roles, the full list of which can be found here. The strike comes after over 18 months of negotiations with some of gaming’s largest companies - including Activision, EA, Insomniac, Take-Two, and WB Games - over AI protections. Read more

entry.title: Earth Defense Force 6 players on Steam will only need to sign into Epic once, say publishers in apology for "lack of advance notice"
entry.summary:
Earth Defense Force 6 players on Steam aren’t happy about having to sign into the Epic Games Store, it seems. The latest entry in the co-op ant-control shooter launched yesterday, and critics reckon it's a decent time. Still, it’s currently sitting at an angry red 'mostly negative' on Steam. In response, D3PUBLISHER have put out an apology statement, reassuring players that this third-party log in will only be required once.

entry.title: S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2 is delayed again, but a developer deep dive is coming soon
entry.summary: S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2: Heart of Chornobyl, the beautifully grotty sci-fi shooter sequel from Ukrainian studio GSC Game World, has been delayed once again. It’s a relatively good-spirited delay, though: first off, it’s not that long, with the previously planned September 5th launch pushed back just a few weeks to November 20th. There’s also clever little in-universe announcement video (one which gives the fourth wall a study kick on its way out), and an accompanying promise of a meaty "developer deep dive video", set to reveal much more of the game’s radioactive hellscape on August 12th. entry.title: Over 500 World of Warcraft developers at Blizzard have voted to form Microsoft’s biggest wall-to-wall union

Following the news earlier this week that 241 Bethesda Games Studios staffers had formed what was at the time the biggest wall-to-wall under Microsoft, The Verge reports that over 500 World Of Warcraft developers have voted to form their own union, alongside the Communication Workers of America (CWA). entry.title: The 10 best immersive sims on PC
entry.summary:
The immersive sim has seen a revival in recent years. Not only from larger studios like Arkane, keeping the faith alive with their time loops and space stations, but also from a bunch of smaller developers bravely exploring a typically ambitious genre. RPS has always had an affinity for these systemically luxuriant simulations, historically lauding the likes of the original Deus Ex as the best game ever made. But given everything that has come since, is that still the case? Only one way to find out: make a big list.
